definition: to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum

sentences.english: I learnt to jive there when they got the jukebox.
sentences.chinese: 他們安了自動點唱機後，我在那兒學會了跳搖擺舞。

sentences.english: A , rock'n roll, the United States sways the dance all to cowboy dance influence having got certainly.
sentences.chinese: 波普，搖滾，美國搖擺舞都對牛仔舞有着一定的影響。

sentences.english: 6 small potatoes are dancing the jive.
sentences.chinese: 六個小土豆正在跳搖擺舞。

sentences.english: The waggle dancers depend upon a vertical dancing platform for direction and orientation, but Dr. Dornhaus flipped some beehives on their sides at her study site among agricultural fields in Germany.
sentences.chinese: 搖擺舞者需要依靠一個垂直的舞蹈平臺掌握方向。

sentences.english: They're learning to swing dance in a class called whole body thinking.
sentences.chinese: 他們正在一節叫做“全身思考”的課堂中學習搖擺舞。

sentences.english: Did the wagging dance tell the bees how far away the food was?
sentences.chinese: 搖擺舞有沒有告訴蜜蜂食物到蜂箱的距離有多遠？
